name: Trace
headline: Voice AI Customer Support for Financial Services
description:
We started Trace because we believe AI should wow customers, not frustrate them. As a result, we prioritize reliability and seamless customer interactions. 

Trace AI agents resolve calls end-to-end, securely integrating with bank systems and external APIs. So far, our agents handle quoting, application, and transaction tracking calls for our partners — but we’re still searching for new exciting use cases.

Question to all fintechs/banks: Which customer requests keep coming back to you? We’d love to learn how you handle them now and if they are ripe for automation.

founders.name: Saner Cakir, Founder
founders.description: Saner (CEO @ Trace) has a remarkable track record of building reliable AI solutions for high-stakes applications. While studying Electrical Engineering and CS at UC Berkeley, he contributed to multiple publications in robot learning and computer vision at BAIR Lab. Before Trace, Saner co-built an AI copilot for surgeons that helped save lives during cardiothoracic surgeries at UCSF.

founders.name: Kayla Lee, COO & Founder
founders.description: Kayla (COO @ Trace) did her bachelor’s and master’s in CS at UC Berkeley, where she led groundbreaking NLP research under Professor Dan Klein. Before Trace, Kayla co-built an AI copilot for surgeons that helped save lives during cardiothoracic surgeries at UCSF. Kayla was also a national-level athlete in fencing and lacrosse — her unwavering perseverance and laser focus have become core values of Trace.

founders.name: Yash Pansari, Founder
founders.description: Yash (CTO @ Trace) studied Math and CS at UC Berkeley and Stanford (MS). Before Trace, he worked as a Quant Researcher at Optiver and Goldman Sachs, where he enabled millions of dollars in annual profitability through his high-frequency trading strategies. He also contributed to ML research published by Stanford, Berkeley, and the US Department of Energy (LBNL).

generated_description:
Trace, founded in 2024 and proudly part of Y Combinator's Batch W25, is revolutionizing customer support in the financial services sector with the power of voice AI. Based in San Francisco, this nimble startup, currently a team of three, is on a mission to ensure that AI serves to impress customers rather than frustrate them. They believe that customer interactions should be seamless and reliable.

Here's how they do it: Trace's AI agents are not your typical chatbots. They can handle calls end-to-end, integrating securely with banking systems and external APIs. This means they can efficiently manage tasks like quoting, application processing, and tracking transactions, which really streamlines the whole customer service experience. And they’re always on the lookout for new use cases to tackle.

What’s particularly interesting about Trace is their openness to feedback. They’re asking fintechs and banks: “Which customer requests keep coming back to you?” This demonstrates a commitment to not only understanding existing challenges but also actively shaping their AI’s capabilities to address industry needs.

Key Features:
- **Security**: They ensure AI never accesses user information without proper authentication.
- **Seamless Interactions**: Their agents continue smoothly without interruptions, enhancing user experience.
- **Compliance**: Adherence to company policies is built into their AI’s design.
- **Independence**: Unlike other systems that just provide information, Trace agents complete tasks on behalf of the user.

As they continue to grow, they aim to provide instant and consistent support, eliminating wait times and bad attitudes. The reception so far has been overwhelmingly positive, with partners noting how Trace surpasses internal efforts in efficiency and user experience.

If you're in fintech or banking, here's your cue — connect with Trace to explore if your repetitive customer requests are ripe for automation. Because if it's about making customer interactions extraordinary, Trace might just be the answer.

For more information, visit their website at [Trace Technologies](http://tracetec.co).
